result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Morgano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Balance of court costs, fees, surcharges, and restitution.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Follow through with AODA Assessment that was completed through the Sober America Program and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Write letter of apology to Wrico Stamping
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.
No contact with Co-Actors, Wrico Stamping, and employees at Wrico Stamping.
$406.00 to be paid to Wrico, joint and several with Co-Defendants, and $6,610.69 (solely) To Wrico Stamping at the rate of $182.00 per month starting 08-01-2014 as a Condition of Probation.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  120 Days Huber Non Working Hours With Standard Release Conditions - Last 60 Days STAYED to be used at the Agent's discretion.  Defendant to report to Huber by Noon on 05-02-2014.
